description: (usually postpositive) (Brit, slang) without money.  Variant of skinned, past participle of skin.
Word origin and history for skint: adj. "broke, out of money," 1925, slang variant of skinned, past participle of skin (v.).

adjectives.description: skint (comparative skinter or more skint, superlative skintest or most skint)

entries.meaning: (slang, Britain, Australia) Penniless, poor, impecunious, broke.
